title: Troll (monster)
data:

*This page is about the troll [monster](/Monster "Monster"). For the player race, see [troll](/Troll "Troll").* *For a list of all trolls, see [list of trolls](/List_of_trolls "List of trolls").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The common troll is a huge and physically powerful humanoid creature. Short on intelligence but long on brawn, its thick knobbly hide heals rapidly from most wounds.***“Buckshank bold and Elfinstone, And more than I can mention here, They caused to be built so stout a ship, And unto Iceland they would steer. They launched the ship upon the main, Which bellowed like a wrathful bear; Down to the bottom the vessel sank, A laidly Trold has dragged it there.” -George Borrow, \_Lavengro: The Scholar, the Gypsy, the Priest\_. 1851. |

## Useful Info

**Trolls** are hulking brutes that lumber into melee, tearing apart their opponents with powerful attacks. Although they lack resistances, they regenerate [HP](/HP "HP") quickly and are fairly durable for early monsters. They are most commonly found in the late [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"), [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"), and [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"). More powerful [trolls](/List_of_trolls "List of trolls") will harass you throughout most of the game.

## Tips & Tricks

- Use caution when you first encounter trolls; low-level melee fighters may not be able to survive long enough in melee to land a killing blow, and trollish regeneration makes it so they always win wars of attrition. Use wands or some other form of ranged attack to soften them up before engaging.
- [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud") can render them fit for nuking from afar, but [stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing") still has risks. They may still land a hit or two in melee, so don't move in for the kill unless you've got full health.
- Killing a troll has a 33% chance to produce a [troll leather armour](/Troll_leather_armour "Troll leather armour") (unless you blow it up with an [Orb of destruction](/Orb_of_destruction "Orb of destruction") or a [wand of disintegration](/Wand_of_disintegration "Wand of disintegration")). The armour provides you with slightly better defense than a [leather armour](/Leather_armour "Leather armour") and a source of health [regeneration](/Regeneration "Regeneration").
- If you insist on taking them in melee, a good [venom](/Venom "Venom")-branded weapon will effectively counter their regeneration.
html:
Troll (monster)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

This page is about the troll monster. For the player race, see troll. For a list of all trolls, see list of trolls.

troll T 
HP 25-52
HD 7
XP 304
Speed 10
AC 3
EV 10
Will 20
Attack1 20 (bite: plain)
Attack2 15 (claw: plain)
Attack3 15 (claw: plain)
Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type troll, troll
Flags Regenerates
Speaks
Warm-blooded
The common troll is a huge and physically powerful humanoid creature. Short on intelligence but long on brawn, its thick knobbly hide heals rapidly from most wounds.

“Buckshank bold and Elfinstone,
And more than I can mention here,
They caused to be built so stout a ship,
And unto Iceland they would steer.

They launched the ship upon the main,
Which bellowed like a wrathful bear;
Down to the bottom the vessel sank,
A laidly Trold has dragged it there.”
-George Borrow, _Lavengro: The Scholar, the Gypsy, the Priest_. 1851.

Useful Info

Trolls are hulking brutes that lumber into melee, tearing apart their opponents with powerful attacks. Although they lack resistances, they regenerate HP quickly and are fairly durable for early monsters. They are most commonly found in the late Dungeon, Orcish Mines, and the Vaults. More powerful trolls will harass you throughout most of the game.

Tips & Tricks

  • Use caution when you first encounter trolls; low-level melee fighters may not be able to survive long enough in melee to land a killing blow, and trollish regeneration makes it so they always win wars of attrition. Use wands or some other form of ranged attack to soften them up before engaging.
  • Mephitic Cloud can render them fit for nuking from afar, but stabbing still has risks. They may still land a hit or two in melee, so don't move in for the kill unless you've got full health.
  • Killing a troll has a 33% chance to produce a troll leather armour (unless you blow it up with an Orb of destruction or a wand of disintegration). The armour provides you with slightly better defense than a leather armour and a source of health regeneration.
  • If you insist on taking them in melee, a good venom-branded weapon will effectively counter their regeneration.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Troll_(monster)&oldid=54467"

==Useful Info==
'''Trolls''' are hulking brutes that lumber into melee, tearing apart their opponents with powerful attacks. Although they lack resistances, they regenerate [[HP]] quickly and are fairly durable for early monsters. They are most commonly found in the late [[Dungeon]], [[Orcish Mines]], and [[the Vaults]]. More powerful [[List of trolls|trolls]] will harass you throughout most of the game.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Use caution when you first encounter trolls; low-level melee fighters may not be able to survive long enough in melee to land a killing blow, and trollish regeneration makes it so they always win wars of attrition. Use wands or some other form of ranged attack to soften them up before engaging.
*[[Mephitic Cloud]] can render them fit for nuking from afar, but [[stabbing]] still has risks. They may still land a hit or two in melee, so don't move in for the kill unless you've got full health.
*Killing a troll has a 33% chance to produce a [[troll leather armour]] (unless you blow it up with an [[Orb of destruction]] or a [[wand of disintegration]]). The armour provides you with slightly better defense than a [[leather armour]] and a source of health [[regeneration]].
*If you insist on taking them in melee, a good [[venom]]-branded weapon will effectively counter their regeneration.
